entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 4:53PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Wind speeds are decreasing across the region this evening. However, an area of blowing dust continues to move from north to south across eastern Colorado and extreme western Kansas. Visibilities reduced to 2 or 3 miles are still possible over the next hour as this dust plume gradually disperses. Expect improving weather conditions to continue.

Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 02 at 4:48PM MST until December 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County. Includes Interstate 25 mile marker 71 at Bordeaux. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening.
